revised_title: The Emperor of China's Journey into Eastern Tartary and Observations on Geography, Meteorology, and Magnetic Declination
tldr: The Emperor of China embarks on a journey into Eastern Tartary to visit ancestral tombs and make astronomical observations. The journey covers over 1,000 miles, passing through mountainous terrain, desolate plains, and ruined cities. The emperor's entourage includes his son, queens, kings, and numerous officials, all accompanied by a vast train of attendants and equipment for scientific observations and measurements.
